Test Suite

Test Signals and Trajectories

test_suite.test_signal_types(expected)[source]

  1. Check that the forward simulated signal is a Nifti file

test_suite.test_trajectory_types(expected)[source]

  1. Check that the forward simulated trajectory is a .npy file

test_suite.test_signal_shapes(input, expected)[source]

  1. Check that the forward simulated signal matches the number of bvals and bvecs used in the ‘imaging’ experiment

test_suite.test_custom_diffusion_scheme(input, expected)[source]

1. Check that the forward simulated signal matches the number of bvals and bvecs used in the PGSE experiment w/ ‘custom’ bvals and bvecs (i.e., loaded in from a path)

test_suite.test_trajectory_shapes(input, expected)[source]

  1. Check that the forward simulated trajectories match the number of simulated spins

Test Physics

test_suite.test_water_physics(input, expected)[source]

  1. Check that the forward simulated water-only signal corresponds to a diffusion tensor matching the input water diffusivity

  2. Check that the forward simulated water-only signal corresponds to an isotropic diffusion tensor

test_suite.test_fiber_physics_multi(input, expected)[source]

  1. Check that the forward simulated fiber-only signal corresponds to a diffusion tensor matching the input fiber diffusivities (with multiple fibers)

  2. Check that the forward simulated fiber-only signal corresponds to an anisotropic diffusion tensor (with multiple fibers)

test_suite.test_fiber_physics_single(input, expected)[source]

  1. Check that the forward simulated fiber-only signal corresponds to a diffusion tensor matching the input fiber diffusivities (with only one fiber)

  2. Check that the forward simulated fiber-only signal corresponds to an anisotropic diffusion tensor (with only one fiber)

test_suite.test_cell_physics_multi(input)[source]

1. Check that the forward simulated cell-only signal corresponds to an isotropic diffusion tensor (for multiple cells) ‘Note’: the inverse problem measured diffusivity here will strongly depend on the diffusion time, thus, this test only requires that the cell diffusion be isotropic

test_suite.test_cell_physics_single(input)[source]

1. Check that the forward simulated cell-only signal corresponds to an isotropic diffusion tensor (for only one cell) ‘Note’: the inverse problem measured diffusivity here will strongly depend on the diffusion time, thus, this test only requires that the cell diffusion be isotropic
